I think it really depends on how fishing impacts your life. Think about it:  If the thread is about your lawnmower and how to sharpen the blade, its really just a thread about how to get your lawn mowed faster so you can go fishing.  If its a thread about gas prices, its really just a fishing thread about how to make sure you can afford gas to get out to your fishing hole.  If its a thread about your friend's and family's and their health, its b/c time at the hospital or worse really takes away from time spent fishing, not to mention sadness makes fishing a lot less enjoyable.  If its a thread about quitting smoking, its because money saved from smokes buys tackle and fuel and maybe a fly-in trip somewhere.  If its a thread about your water heater bursting, its b/c you cant go fishing if you basement is filled with three feet of water.  If its a thread about a big buck, well thats simply about having some freezer food handy, so you can get dinner over quick and back out onto the lake for a few more casts before the sun goes down.  The reality is, life dramas big and small all relate to fishing in someway or another.
